required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study in Healthy Subjects to Compare Two Tablet Formulations of Memantine (Ebixa®) in Fasted and Fed Conditions
clinical_study.official_title: Interventional, Randomized, Single-dose, Open-label, Crossover, Bioequivalence Study in Healthy Subjects to Compare Two Pharmaceutical Formulations of Memantine (Ebixa®) in Fasted and Fed Conditions

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the release of memantine into the bloodstream of two different formulations: one formulation containing lactose and one without lactose.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study consists of two cohorts: A1 and A2.
Subjects in Cohort A1 will be administered the investigational medicinal product (IMP) in a fasted state and subjects in Cohort A2 will be administered the IMP in a fed state.
Each subject will change cohort during study participation, so that dosing will be done over two periods: either first fed and then fasted, or first fasted and then fed. The two periods will be separated by a period of 28 days (+7 days) where no investigational medicinal product is given.
All subjects will be confined to the clinic from one day prior to dosing until Day 4 (72 hours post-dose) in each dosing period.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-72h in fed state for test and reference treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From zero to 72 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: Area under the memantine plasma concentration-time curve

primary_outcome.measure: AUC0-72h in fasted state for test and reference treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From zero to 72 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: Area under the memantine plasma concentration-time curve

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax of memantine in fed state for test and reference treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From zero to 72 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration of memantine

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax of memantine in fasted state for test and reference treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: From zero to 72 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration of memantine

secondary_outcome.measure: tmax in fed state for test and reference treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From zero to 72 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Nominal time corresponding to the occurrence of Cmax

secondary_outcome.measure: tmax in fasted state for test and reference treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From zero to 72 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: Nominal time corresponding to the occurrence of Cmax

arm_group.description: (treatment A - test) - 10 mg; orally as a single dose in fed and fasted state
(treatment B - reference) - 10 mg, orally as a single dose in fed and fasted state

intervention.description: Lactose-free memantine tablet, 10 mg; orally as a single dose
Lactose-containing memantine tablet, 10 mg, orally as a single dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy men and women ≥18 years of age with a body mass index (BMI) ≥18.5 and ≤28 kg/m2.
- Women must be non-pregnant and non-lactating.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subject has any concurrent disorder that may affect the particular target or absorption, distribution, or elimination of the IMP.
Other in- and exclusion criteria may apply
